summary: The Fine Arts Protection Act of 2025 mandates the Comptroller General of the United States to review the Fine Arts Program managed by the General Services Administration (GSA). The review will assess the value and condition of the GSA's Fine Arts Collection, including works from New Deal programs, as well as the program's staffing, funding, and management practices. The Comptroller General will submit a report with findings and recommendations to Congress, addressing the program's management and potential future, including whether the GSA should continue managing the collection.
